intro: Verbascum micranthum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Verbascum micranthum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its soothing effects.
